abstract: A special committee of Dell Inc.’s board said on Wednesday that it would be willing to accept the latest takeover bid by its founder, worth $13.75 a share, if he dropped his demand for a change to the voting rules.
snippet: A special committee of Dell Inc.’s board said on Wednesday that it would be willing to accept the latest takeover bid by its founder, worth $13.75 a share, if he dropped his demand for a change to the voting rules.
lead_paragraph: Michael S. Dell’s effort of several months to buy the company that bears his name was thrown into jeopardy on Wednesday, as a special committee of the computer maker’s board refused his demand to change the voting rules on the huge buyout.

headline.main: Dell Buyout Bid in Peril as Voting Rule Remains
headline.print_headline: Dell Takeover Bid in Peril As a Voting Rule Remains

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
